headline: FedEx’s road to fortune: Adopt gig worker model and dominate B2C delivery
summary: By Satish Jindel (The views expressed here are solely those of the author and do not necessarily represent the views of FreightWaves or its affiliates.) In 2019, FedEx dropped Amazon as a customer for B2C parcels because the retailer was becoming a competitor, with its own last-mile delivery solution that mimicked FedEx Ground’s model for […] The post FedEx’s road to fortune: Adopt gig worker model and dominate B2C delivery appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Uber: Riding The Autonomous Wave To Profitable Growth
summary: Discover why Uber's evolving into a Mobility Super-App offers strong growth, profitability, and an attractive investment. Click here to read my latest analysis.

headline: Travel and Pay with LuggageToShip.com's New AI Platform
summary: LuggageToShip.com, the award-winning Silicon Valley-based AI-powered travel platform, announces the launch of its next-generation global shipping and mobility marketplace — a platform that lets travelers, students, and businesses ship luggage and goods anywhere with instant zip-to-zip quotes, AI-optimized routing, and seamless payment.

headline: Why Lucid Group (LCID) Is Up on Uber Robotaxi Partnership and North American Studio Expansion
summary: Lucid Group recently marked several milestones, including the start of Gravity SUV deliveries in Canada and the opening of two new Studio and Service Centers in San Jose and San Diego, California. In addition to expanding its physical footprint, Lucid announced a major partnership with Uber to deploy 20,000 Gravity Robotaxis in major U.S. cities, signaling increasing ambitions in autonomous mobility. We'll examine how the Uber partnership and new Studio launches could influence Lucid's...
